weather_report:
As darkness blankets Downtown San Francisco, a steady rain cascades from the heavens, painting a melancholic scene of blurred city lights shimmering through the mist. The air is filled with the rich scent of damp earth, evoking a sense of nostalgia. Gusts of wind carry the chill of the approaching winter, creating an atmosphere both invigorating and soothing. Clouds loom low, forming a dense marine layer, swirling around the Golden Gate in a haunting embrace, while the faint outlines of the hills emerge like ghostly figures in the distance.

Tomorrow’s forecast foretells a continuation of this watery motif, shifting from rain to sporadic showers and perhaps even thunder, only to yield to a rare glimpse of sunshine later in the day. The temperatures will hover in the cool margins, urging coats and sturdy shoes to fend off the elements. A wool or fleece layering will serve well for those braving the outdoors, as the brisk winds tease from the west. For those who prefer indoor activities, consider exploring a quiet café around the corner, immersing yourself in a book or conversing with friends as the world outside becomes a silver-played sonnet of rain against glass.
